snippet: In the first day of a federal challenge to the police program, a Bronx assistant district attorney told a judge about concerns over the legality of some trespassing arrests.
abstract: Bronx Assistant District Attorney Jeannette M Rucker testifies in Federal District Court in Manhattan, on first day of hearing in critical challenge to New York City Police Dept's stop-and-frisk tactics; Rucker testifies that she believes police have wrongly stopped and arrested innocent people for trespassing; hearing is first court proceeding in which a federal judge is expected to rule whether city has engaged in a pattern of unconstitutional stops.
lead_paragraph: In the first day of a federal challenge to the police program, a Bronx assistant district attorney told a judge about concerns over the legality of some trespassing arrests.

headline.seo: Federal Hearing Challenging Police Stop and Frisk Program Begins
